subject: Real Estate
title: Is the Next Crash Already Forming?
description: A quick win: understand Is the Next Crash Already Forming?.

hook.text: Home prices in many countries have outpaced wages for a decade. Interest rates are rising. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: Some markets show classic bubble signals: high price-to-income, low inventory, and speculative frenzy.

discovery.text: But this cycle is different in one key way â€” supply is genuinely constrained, not just speculated away.

twist.text: A crash requires a trigger: mass unemployment, rate spikes, or a credit freeze. Overvaluation alone isn't enough.

climax.text: The warning signs are flashing, but history shows markets can stay irrational longer than you can stay solvent.

punchline.text: The signs are there. The timing never is.

quiz.question: What typically triggers a housing crash beyond overvaluation?
options: Mass unemployment or a credit freeze
